folder: 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building - Chanin Building ; Chrysler Building ; New York Daily News ; Waldorf-Astoria Hotel., Manhattan, NY
text:
317-323 E. 34th Street, (Harriet Hubbard Ayer Building), north side, between First and Second Avenues, showing a general view northwestward from this location. In the foreground are, St. Gabriels Park, the 2nd Ave. "E" and various tenements. The photographer utilizes the changing 42nd Street outline for a background. Note the construction stage of the Chrysler and News Buildings. Of earlier birth than these is the Chanin Building as shown to the left. A close inspection of the two later views will disclose the erection details attending the building of the Hotel Waldorf-Astoria on Lexington and Park Avenues. This appears between the graceful Chrysler and the utilitarian News Buildings.

View 1: September 10, 1929
Views 2,3: Sept. 17, 1930

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building - Chanin Building ; Chrysler Building ; New York Daily News ; Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.]

folder: 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building., Manhattan, NY
text:
317-323 E. 34th Street, (Harriet Hubbard Ayer Building), north side, between First and Second Avenues, (general view northward).

Two photos from the above location viewing towards the 42nd Street-Grand Central zone showing towering structures there. For identification of same see other views. Note in the foreground of View 2, a corner of St. Gabriel's Park, several of the school buildings and Library identified with this name, and the Second Avenue "El".

September 17, 1930
Views: 1-2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building.]

folder: 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building., Manhattan, NY
text:
321 East 34th Street, north side, between First and Second Avenues, (Harriet Hubbard Ayer Building) general view northward.

Three views forming a panoramic arrangement to show the 42nd Street-Midtown skyline of Manhattan. From left to right these buildings are: No. 10 E. 40th Street, No. 500 Fifth Avenue (under construction), The Leftcourt Colonial (No. 295 Madison Avenue), the Lincoln, the Chanin, the Chrysler and the News. Prior to 1929 none of these structures were standing.

Across the foreground runs the Second Avenue "El" passing the westerly side of St. Gabriel's Park. This garden and play area is between E. 35th and 36th Streets. In 1939, this will undergo radical changes as the new 38th Street-East River Tunnel approach will pass thru same to an entrance on 34th Street.

P. L. Sperr

September 17, 1930
Views: 1-2-3
title: General view - [Manhattan - 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building.]

title: General view - [Manhattan - 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building.]

text:
A general view of the midtown Manhattan Grand Central-42nd Street zone containing the outstanding skyscrapers (left to right), the No. 10 East 40th Street Bldg., the Lefcourt-Colonial Bldg., the Lincoln Bldg., the Channin Bldg., the Chrysler Bldg., and the News Bldg. The photographer is viewing northwestward from atop the Harriet Hubbard Ayer Bldg. at No. 321 East 34th Street. In the lower right is a portion of St. Gabriels Park east of Second Avenue.

1930

Ewing Galloway
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - 42nd Street - [Grand Central.]

folder: 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building., Manhattan, NY
text:
321 East 34th Street (Harriet Hubbard Ayer Building) north side, between First and Second Avenues, showing a (general view westward) and viewing to the north, across Second Avenue and its "El" line.

On this side of same, appears, the westerly portion of St. Gabriel's Park (35th-36th Street's) and the future plaza of the Midtown-Queens Tunnel (36th-37th Street's).

At the right background beyond this section of Murray Hill, are the skyscrapers forming the 42nd Street outline. The bases of these in View 3 are, from left to right respectively, the Lincoln, the Chanin, the Chrysler and the News Buildings.

October 13, 1939
Views 1, 2, 3

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building.]

folder: 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building., Manhattan, NY
text:
321 East 34th Street (Harriet Hubbard Ayer Building) north side, between First and Second Avenues, showing a (general view northeastward).

The photographers direction is towards the East River and he is viewing across the easterly half of St. Gabriel's Park, to the Manhattan entrance and future plaza of the Midtown-Queens Tunnel at First Avenue and East 37th Street.

View No. 3 is slightly east and shows prominently the New York Steam Company plant at 35th Street.

October 13, 1939
Views 1, 2, 3

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building.]

title: General view - [Manhattan - 34th Street (East) - Harriet Hubbard Ayer building.]

text:
view 1:
A view from the Chanin Building. St. Gabriel's Park is at the center, with the clearing at 38th Street for the Queens Midtown Tunnel adjacent to the Park. The Second Avenue "el" cuts diagonally across the foreground.

P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 5, 1940

view 2:
Same, but north to 42nd St., showing Tudor City (left).
P.L. Sperr, photographer
July 5, 1940
title: Manhattan: St. Gabriel's Park.
